alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Lake County; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued January 07 at 2:53PM PST until January 09 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...In California, Modoc County, the Warner Mountains. In Oregon, Eastern Klamath County and most of Lake County. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult due to blowing snow causing whiteout conditions. High profile vehicles may also observe difficult driving conditions in cross winds. Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest confidence for warning level winds is the terrain above 5500 feet. However, even valley locations have a very high chance (80% +) for at least advisory strength wind gusts (45-57 mph). Snow impactful to driving conditions (1-5 inches) is also expected on Tuesday and so winter weather headlines may be combined with the wind hazard in future updates. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Dangerous driving conditions are possible, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Downed trees and power lines are possible. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: Central and Eastern Lake County; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County
